infoTargets.title: suburbs
paragraphs: Domestic water use is water used for indoor and outdoor household purposes— all the things you do at home: drinking, preparing food, bathing, washing clothes and dishes, brushing your teeth, watering the garden, and even washing the dog.

infoTargets.title: town
paragraphs: More than 97% of the nation’s 148,000 public water systems are small systems, meaning they serve 10,000 or fewer people.

infoTargets.title: water_treatment_plant
paragraphs: Drinking water sources are subject to contamination and require appropriate treatment to remove disease-causing agents. Public drinking water systems use various methods of water treatment to provide safe drinking water for their communities.

infoTargets.title: city
paragraphs: City dwellers rely on public water systems to provide safe drinking water.

infoTargets.title: farm
paragraphs: When agricultural water is used effectively and safely, production and crop yield are positively affected. A decrease in applied water can cause production and yield to decrease.
